title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: AACR Project GENIE publicly accessible international cancer registry real-world data assembled data sharing 19 leading cancer centers world. GENIE aggregates, harmonizes, links clinical-grade, next-generation cancer genomic sequencing data clinical outcomes obtained routine medical practice cancer patients treated institutions, although clinical information available limited (~<10 variables).

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: goal Project GENIE BPC (Biopharma Collaborative) augment existing registry genomic data enhanced clinical (phenomic) data support clinical-genomics analyses. Phenomic data curated using PRISSMM curation model. Currently MSK, Dana Farber, Vanderbilt University Health Network participating institutions. GENIE BPC expanded institutions phase II. GENIE BPC sponsors six projects involve augmenting genomic data Project GENIE include PRISSMM phenomic data cancer-related outcomes. project encompasses single cancer site. projects based curating data PRISSMM phenomic data curation model, variables available project may vary. six projects : Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) Colon/rectal cancer (CRC) Breast cancer (BrCa) Pancreas cancer (PANC) Bladder cancer (BLADDER) Prostate cancer (Prostate)

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: GENIE BPC comprised several phenomic (clinical) elements include data AACR Project GENIE Tier 1 registry, institutions’ tumor registries, manual curation based institutions’ electronic health records (PRISSMM phenomic data model), derived variables based data elements. elements : Patient Characteristics Cancer Diagnosis: BPC Project Cancer Cancer Diagnosis: Non-BPC Project Cancer Cancer-Directed Drugs Cancer-Directed Radiation Therapy PRISSMM Pathology PRISSMM Imaging PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessments PRISSMM Tumor Marker Cancer Panel Test vignette describe structure element (dataset).

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Patient Characteristics dataset structured one record per patient. dataset includes variables date death, last known alive date, number pathology reports, imaging reports, medical oncologist assessments, along many demographic vital status variables. Patient Characteristics dataset can linked datasets using cohort record_id.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Two Cancer Diagnosis datasets provided: BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset Non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset contains one record per BPC Project cancer diagnosis, per patient. BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset can linked following datasets: Cancer-Directed Regimen dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Cancer Panel Test dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Patient Characteristics, PRISSMM Pathology, PRISSMM Imaging, PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment datasets using cohort record_id

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset contains one record per non-BPC Project cancer diagnosis, per patient. dataset includes two types cancer diagnoses: 1) non-BPC Project invasive cancer situ/non-invasive cancer diagnoses, 2) tumors. Non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset can linked following datasets: Cancer-Directed Regimen Dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Patient Characteristics, PRISSMM Pathology, PRISSMM Imaging, PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment datasets using cohort record_id linked Cancer Panel Test dataset non-BPC Project cancer diagnoses genomically sequenced

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Cancer-Directed Regimen dataset structured one record per regimen-associated cancer diagnosis, per patient. Cancer-directed regimens curated cancer diagnoses, including BPC Project non-BPC Project cancers. regimen can consist one drug five drugs given together. Cancer-directed drugs include anti-neoplastic drugs, immunotherapies, targeted therapies, hormone therapies. break treatment ≥8 weeks used indicate end regimen; even drugs regimen re-initiated 8+ weeks later, considered new regimen. cancer-directed drug part investigational drug trial, drug name(s) drugs_drug_1-drugs_drug_5 set “Investigational Drug” end date interval match start date interval. Identification investigational drugs varies institution depending contractual obligations. institutions, drugs part investigational trial required masked, even standard care. institutions, investigational drug(s) required masked. Cancer-Directed Regimen can linked following datasets: BPC Project non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis datasets using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Cancer Panel Test dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Patient Characteristics, PRISSMM Pathology, PRISSMM Imaging, PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment datasets using cohort record_id

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Cancer-Directed Radiation Therapy dataset structured one record per radiation therapy-associated cancer diagnosis, per patient. example, radiation therapy associated single cancer diagnosis, one corresponding record dataset. radiation therapy associated two cancer diagnoses, two corresponding records dataset: one first associated cancer diagnosis another second associated cancer diagnosis. unknown cancer diagnosis radiation therapy associated , still one record dataset. Radiation therapy curated beginning within 30 days first BPC Project cancer diagnosis. subsequent radiation therapies recorded. Additional radiation therapy corresponding non-BPC Project Cancers may recorded. Radiation therapy data available following cohorts: PANC, Prostate, BLADDER. dataset can linked following datasets: BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis, Non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis, Cancer-Directed Regimen, Cancer Panel Test datasets datasets using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Patient Characteristics, PRISSMM Pathology, PRISSMM Imaging, PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment datasets using cohort record_id.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: PRISSMM Pathology dataset structured one record per pathology report, per patient. pathology reports beginning month year first BPC Project cancer diagnosis subsequent pathology reports recorded (including pathology reports corresponding non-BPC Project cancer subsequent BPC Project cancer diagnoses). PRISSMM Pathology dataset can linked following datasets: Cancer Panel Test dataset using cohort record_id, ca_seq, path_proc_number path_report_number Patient Characteristics, BPC Project Non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis, Cancer-Directed Regimen, PRISSMM Imaging, PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment datasets using cohort record_id

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: PRISSMM Imaging dataset structured one record per imaging report, per patient. imaging reports beginning month year first BPC Project cancer diagnosis subsequent imaging reports recorded (including imaging reports corresponding non-BPC Project cancer subsequent BPC Project cancer diagnoses). PRISSMM Imaging dataset can linked datasets using variable record_id.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment dataset structured one row per curated medical oncologist assessment, per patient. Medical oncologist assessments curated beginning month year first BPC Project cancer diagnosis. One medical oncologist assessment per month curated. PRISSMM Medical Oncologist Assessment dataset can linked datasets using variable record_id.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: PRISSMM Tumor Marker dataset structured one record per curated tumor marker result, per patient. serum-based tumor markers related diagnosis/prognosis cancer curated. Tumor marker data available following cohorts: CRC, BrCa, PANC, Prostate. Note: variables pertaining PD-L1, MSI MMR recorded pathology dataset. PRISSMM Tumor Marker dataset can linked datasets using variable record_id.

title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Cancer Panel Test dataset structured one record per cancer panel test associated cancer diagnosis, per patient. cancer panel test refers multi-gene panels performed next generation sequencing (NGS) assays. terms “cancer panel test (CPT)” “next generation sequencing (NGS)” used interchangeably. Cancer Panel Test dataset can linked following datasets: BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq Cancer-Directed Regimen dataset using variables cohort, record_id ca_seq PRISSMM Pathology dataset using cohort, record_id, ca_seq, path_proc_number path_report_number Note: dataset linked non-BPC Project Cancer Diagnosis dataset non-BPC Project cancer diagnoses genomically sequenced.

what: Differences Between Synapse and cBioPortal Genomic Data
title: Tutorial: GENIE BPC Data Structure
text: Please note pulling genomic GENIE data Synapse using pull_data_synapse() pulling GENIE data cBioPortal may result small differences data due systematic differences processing pipelines employed Synapse cBioPortal. differences may include: Data formatting - data sets (e.g. CNA files) may appear wide format Synapse data versus long format cBioPortal data, column attributes names may appear sightly different (e.g. fusions files). Default filtering - default, cBioPortal filters Silent, Intron, IGR, 3’UTR, 5’UTR, 3’Flank 5’Flank, except promoter mutations TERT gene. See cBioPortal documentation details. mutations retained Synapse processing pipelines. Hugo Symbols - genes one accepted Hugo Symbol may referred differently data sources (e.g. NSD3 alias WHSC1L1). tools exist help resolve gene aliases across genomic data sources. See gnomeR::recode_alias(), cbioportal::get_alias() vignettes {gnomeR} {cbioportalR} information use functions work gene aliases.

title: Tutorial: drug_regimen_sunburst
text: drug_regimen_sunburst() function allows user visualize complete treatment course selected diagnoses given analytic cohort. function returns list containing ‘treatment_history’ data frame interactive plot ‘sunburst_plot’.

title: Tutorial: drug_regimen_sunburst
text: Note innermost circle sunburst plot indicates first therapies patients received following diagnosis. circle divided proportionally based percentage patients received particular treatment. subsequent ring sunburst corresponds subsequent treatment regimen, inner rings represent earlier treatments. Together, rings illustrate distribution patterns various treatment regimens.

title: Tutorial: drug_regimen_sunburst
text: example creates sunburst plot first three cancer-directed regimens received patients diagnosed Stage IV NSCLC.
code: nsclc_stg_iv <- create_analytic_cohort(data_synapse = nsclc_2_0$NSCLC_v2.0,                                       stage = c("Stage IV"))  nsclc_treatment <- drug_regimen_sunburst(data_synapse = nsclc_2_0$NSCLC_v2.0,                       data_cohort = nsclc_stg_iv,                       max_n_regimens = 3) head(nsclc_treatment$treatment_history) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   path                                                                       Pop #>   <chr>                                                                    <int> #> 1 Afatinib Dimaleate                                                           1 #> 2 Afatinib Dimaleate-Afatinib Dimaleate, Carboplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium…     1 #> 3 Afatinib Dimaleate-Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium-Osimertinib                1 #> 4 Afatinib Dimaleate-Erlotinib Hydrochloride-Bevacizumab, Carboplatin, Pe…     1 #> 5 Afatinib Dimaleate-Erlotinib Hydrochloride-Investigational Drug              1 #> 6 Afatinib Dimaleate-Gefitinib-Bevacizumab, Carboplatin, Pemetrexed Disod…     1 nsclc_treatment$sunburst_plot

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
code: create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse,   index_ca_seq = 1,   institution,   stage_dx,   histology,   regimen_drugs,   regimen_type = "Exact",   regimen_order,   regimen_order_type,   return_summary = FALSE )

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
text: data_synapse item nested list returned pull_data_synapse() corresponds cancer cohort interest. index_ca_seq Index cancer sequence. Default 1, indicating patient's first index cancer. index cancer also referred BPC Project cancer GENIE BPC Analytic Data Guide; cancer met eligibility criteria project selected random PRISSMM phenomic data curation. Specifying multiple index cancer sequences, e.g. index_ca_seq = c(1, 2) return index cancers patients 1 index cancer return first second index cancers patients multiple. institution GENIE BPC participating institution. See lookup table `cohort_institution` list institutions participating curation cancer cohort. Default selection institutions. parameter corresponds variable `institution` Analytic Data Guide. stage_dx Stage diagnosis. Must one "Stage ", "Stage II", "Stage III", "Stage -III NOS", "Stage IV". default selection stages. Note parameter specified, cases missing stage information automatically excluded resulting cohort. parameter corresponds variable `stage_dx` Analytic Data Guide. histology Cancer histology. cancer cohorts except BrCa (breast cancer), parameter corresponds variable `ca_hist_adeno_squamous` must one "Adenocarcinoma", "Squamous cell", "Sarcoma", "Small cell carcinoma", "Carcinoma", "histologies/mixed tumor".  BrCa, parameter corresponds variable `ca_hist_brca` must one "Invasive lobular carcinoma", "Invasive ductal carcinoma", "histology". default selection histologies. Note parameter specified, cases missing histology information automatically excluded resulting cohort. regimen_drugs Vector names drugs cancer-directed regimen, separated comma. example, specify regimen consisting Carboplatin Pemetrexed, specify regimen_drugs = "Carboplatin, Pemetrexed". Acceptable values found `drug_regimen_list` dataset provided package. parameter corresponds variable `regimen_drugs` Analytic Data Guide. regimen_type Indicates whether regimen(s) specified `regimen_drugs` indicates exact regimen return, regimens containing drugs listed `regimen_drugs` returned. Must one "Exact" "Containing". default "Exact". regimen_order Order cancer-directed regimen. multiple drugs specified, `regimen_order` indicates regimen order drugs; different values `regimen_order` specified different drug regimens. multiple values specified, e.g. c(1, 2), drug regimens met either order criteria returned. regimen_order_type Specifies whether `regimen_order` parameter refers order receipt drug regimen within cancer diagnosis (across drug regimens; "within cancer") order receipt drug regimen within times drug regimen administered (e.g. first time carboplatin pemetrexed received, times patient received carboplatin pemetrexed; "within regimen"). Acceptable values "within cancer" "within regimen". return_summary Specifies whether summary table cohort returned. Default FALSE. `gtsummary` package required return summary table.

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
text: list data frames containing clinical next generation sequencing information patients met specified criteria. Optionally, return_summary = TRUE, list also includes summary tables number records per dataset (`tbl_overall_summary`) well tables key cancer diagnosis (`tbl_cohort`), cancer-directed regimen (`tbl_drugs`) next generation sequencing (`tbl_ngs`) variables.

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
text: See create_analytic_cohort vignette documentation examples.

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
text: Jessica Lavery

title: Select cohort of patients for analysis — create_analytic_cohort
code: # Examples using package test data # Example 1 ---------------------------------- # Create a cohort of all patients with stage IV NSCLC adenocarcinoma and # obtain all of their corresponding clinical and genomic data  ex1 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = genieBPC::nsclc_test_data,   stage_dx = "Stage IV",   histology = "Adenocarcinoma" )  names(ex1) #>  [1] "cohort_pt_char"            "cohort_ca_dx"              #>  [3] "cohort_ca_dx_non_index"    "cohort_ca_drugs"           #>  [5] "cohort_prissmm_imaging"    "cohort_prissmm_pathology"  #>  [7] "cohort_prissmm_md"         "cohort_ngs"                #>  [9] "cohort_mutations_extended" "cohort_fusions"            #> [11] "cohort_cna"                 # Example 2 ---------------------------------- # Create a cohort of all NSCLC patients who received Cisplatin, # Pemetrexed Disodium or Cisplatin, Etoposide as their first drug regimen # for their first index NSCLC  ex2 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = genieBPC::nsclc_test_data,   regimen_drugs = c(     "Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium",     "Cisplatin, Etoposide"   ),   regimen_order = 1,   regimen_order_type = "within cancer" )  # Example 3 ---------------------------------- # Create a cohort of all NSCLC patients who received Cisplatin, Pemetrexed # Disodium at any time throughout the course of treatment for their # cancer diagnosis, # but in the event that the patient received the drug multiple times, # only select the first time.  ex3 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = genieBPC::nsclc_test_data,   regimen_drugs = c("Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium"),   regimen_order = 1,   regimen_order_type = "within regimen" )  # Example 4 ---------------------------------- # Using create_analytic_cohort with pull_data_synapse set_synapse_credentials() #> Error in curl::curl_fetch_memory(url, handle = handle): Timeout was reached [auth-prod.prod.sagebase.org]: #> Operation too slow. Less than 1 bytes/sec transferred the last 600 seconds  nsclc_2_0 <- pull_data_synapse("NSCLC", version = "v2.0-public") #> Error in .get_synapse_token(pat = pat): No credentials found. Have you authenticated yourself? Use #> `set_synapse_credentials()` to set credentials for this session, or pass a #> `pat` (see README:'Data Access & Authentication' for details on #> authentication).  ex4 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = nsclc_2_0$NSCLC_v2.0,   regimen_drugs = c("Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium"),   regimen_order = 1,   regimen_order_type = "within regimen" ) #> Error: object 'nsclc_2_0' not found

text: American Association Research (AACR) Project Genomics Evidence Neoplasia Information Exchange (GENIE) BioPharma Collaborative represents multi-year, multi-institution effort build pan-cancer repository linked clinico-genomic data. genomic clinical data provided multiple releases (separate releases cancer cohort updates following data corrections), stored data sharing platform 'Synapse' https://www.synapse.org/. 'genieBPC' package provides seamless way obtain data corresponding release 'Synapse' prepare datasets analysis.

title: Obtain clinical & genomic data files for GENIE BPC Project — pull_data_synapse
text: cohort Vector list specifying cohort(s) interest. Must one "NSCLC" (Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer), "CRC" (Colorectal Cancer), "BrCa" (Breast Cancer), "PANC" (Pancreatic Cancer), "Prostate" (Prostate Cancer), "BLADDER" (Bladder Cancer). case sensitive. version Vector specifying version cohort. Must match one release versions available specified `cohort` (see `synapse_version()` available cohort versions). entering multiple cohorts, inferred order version numbers passed corresponds order cohorts passed. Therefore, `cohort` `version` must order ensure correct data versions pulled. See examples details. download_location `NULL` (default), data returned list dataframes requested data list items. Otherwise, specify folder path data automatically downloaded . path specified, data read R environment. pat 'Synapse' personal access token

title: Obtain clinical & genomic data files for GENIE BPC Project — pull_data_synapse
text: access data, users must valid 'Synapse' account permission access data set must accepted necessary 'Terms Use'. Users must always authenticate current R session. (see README: Data Access Authentication details). set 'Synapse' Personal Access Token (PAT) session, call:  `set_synapse_credentials(pat = "your_pat")`. credentials stored environmental variable, need call `set_synapse_credentials()` explicitly session. store authentication information environmental variables, add following .Renviron file, restart R session ' (tip: can use `usethis::edit_r_environ()` easily open/edit file): `SYNAPSE_PAT = <-pat>` Alternatively, can pass PAT individual data pull function preferred, although recommended manage PATs outside scripts security purposes.

code: # Example 1 ---------------------------------- # Set up 'Synapse' credentials set_synapse_credentials() #> ✔ You are now connected to 'Synapse' with your Personal Access Token for this R session!  # Print available versions of the data synapse_version(most_recent = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   cohort   version         release_date versions_returned    #>   <chr>    <chr>           <chr>        <chr>                #> 1 BLADDER  v1.2-consortium 2023-11      Most Recent Versions #> 2 BrCa     v1.2-consortium 2022-10      Most Recent Versions #> 3 CRC      v1.3-consortium 2024-02      Most Recent Versions #> 4 NSCLC    v3.1-consortium 2024-04      Most Recent Versions #> 5 PANC     v1.2-consortium 2023-01      Most Recent Versions #> 6 Prostate v1.2-consortium 2023-01      Most Recent Versions  # Pull version 2.0-public for non-small cell lung cancer # and version 2.0-public for colorectal cancer data   ex1 <- pull_data_synapse(    cohort = c("NSCLC", "CRC"),    version = c("v2.0-public", "v2.0-public")  ) #> ✔ pt_char has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_index has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_non_index has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_drugs has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_imaging has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_pathology has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_md has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ tumor_marker has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ cpt has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ mutations_extended has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ fusions has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ cna has been imported for "CRC_v2.0" #> ✔ pt_char has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_index has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_non_index has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_drugs has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_imaging has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_pathology has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_md has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ cpt has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ mutations_extended has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ fusions has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ cna has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0"   names(ex1) #> [1] "CRC_v2.0"   "NSCLC_v2.0"

text: patients multiple associated next generation (NGS) sequencing reports, select one unique NGS report per patient purpose creating analytic dataset based user-defined criterion, including OncoTree code, primary vs. metastatic tumor sample, earliest vs. recent sample. multiple reports patient remain available user-defined specifications, specifications provided, panel largest number genes selected default. Sample optimization performed order arguments specified function, regardless arguments’ order provided user. Namely, OncoTree code prioritized first, sample type prioritized second finally time prioritized last. patients exactly one genomic sample, unique genomic sample returned regardless whether meets user-specified parameters. Running select_unique_ngs() function ensure resulting dataset returned merging next generation sequencing report data onto cohort_ca_dx dataset returned create_analytic_cohort() maintain structure cohort_ca_dx (either one record per patient one record per diagnosis). Currently, multiple diagnoses per patient returned create_analytic_cohort(), using select_unique_ngs() select single NGS report per patient. future iterations, updated one NGS report per diagnosis can selected.

title: Selecting corresponding unique next generation sequencing reports — select_unique_ngs
text: Note NGS dataset serves link clinical genomic data, NGS dataset includes one record per NGS report per patient, including NGS sample ID used link genomic data files. Merging data NGS report onto analytic cohort returned create_analytic_cohort() therefore allows users utilize clinical genomic data available. See select_unique_ngs vignette documentation examples.

title: Selecting corresponding unique next generation sequencing reports — select_unique_ngs
text: Karissa Whiting

title: Selecting corresponding unique next generation sequencing reports — select_unique_ngs
code: # Example 1 ---------------------------------- # Create a cohort of all patients with stage IV NSCLC of # histology adenocarcinoma set_synapse_credentials() #> ✔ You are now connected to 'Synapse' with your Personal Access Token for this R session!  nsclc_2_0 <- pull_data_synapse("NSCLC", version = "v2.0-public") #> ✔ pt_char has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_index has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_dx_non_index has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ ca_drugs has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_imaging has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_pathology has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ prissmm_md has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ cpt has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ mutations_extended has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ fusions has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0" #> ✔ cna has been imported for "NSCLC_v2.0"  ex1 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = nsclc_2_0$NSCLC_v2.0,   stage_dx = c("Stage IV"),   histology = "Adenocarcinoma" )  # select unique next generation sequencing reports for those patients samples_data1 <- select_unique_ngs(   data_cohort = ex1$cohort_ngs,   sample_type = "Primary" ) #> ✔ 63 patients with > 1 next generation sequencing reports were identified #> ✔ 34 of 63 had a unique NGS report selected based on given criteria. #> ! 29 of 63 did not have a unique NGS report selected based on the selected criteria or by having the largest panel, so a NGS report was selected at random (be sure to set a seed for reproducbility!) See `attributes(<your-results>)$random_samples` to view these sample IDs.  # Example 2 ---------------------------------- # Create a cohort of all NSCLC patients who # received Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium or Cisplatin, # Etoposide as their first drug regimen ex2 <- create_analytic_cohort(   data_synapse = nsclc_2_0$NSCLC_v2.0,   regimen_drugs = c(     "Cisplatin, Pemetrexed Disodium",     "Cisplatin, Etoposide"   ),   regimen_order = 1,   regimen_order_type = "within regimen" )  samples_data2 <- select_unique_ngs(   data_cohort = ex2$cohort_ngs,   oncotree_code = "NSCLCPD",   sample_type = "Metastasis",   min_max_time = "max" ) #> ✔ 14 patients with > 1 next generation sequencing reports were identified
